title: 1002-D2
statement: D2. Oracle for f(x) = b * x + (1 - b) * (1 - x) mod 2time limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputImplement a quantum oracle onNqubits which implements the following function:Here(a vector ofNintegers, each of which can be 0 or 1), andis a vector ofN1s.For an explanation on how this type of quantum oracles works, seeIntroduction to quantum oracles.You have to implement an operation which takes the following inputs:an array ofNqubitsxin arbitrary state (input register),1 ≤N≤ 8,a qubityin arbitrary state (output qubit),an array ofNintegersb, representing the vector. Each element ofbwill be 0 or 1.The operation doesn't have an output; its "output" is the state in which it leaves the qubits.Your code should have the following signature:namespace Solution {open Microsoft.Quantum.Primitive;open Microsoft.Quantum.Canon;operation Solve (x : Qubit[], y : Qubit, b : Int[]) : (){body{// your code here}}}
